topic.title: Ways to find new ZeroNet content
topic.body: All the ways you use to find sites, content and fun on ZeroNet

2_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: you have made me so happy :D

> [chemlord](#comment_1_19ChcQ5esNbwygpkJ2dm8YBMymprTHp3fE): hello

I reply to you chemlord
everything is really quite fast.  it's very nice

8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: how do you make a subboard or subzero :D

also, how do i find out what all the subboards are?

also, how do i sort by upzeros?  can this ever be threaded?  should i really just read the docs and code my own zerosite?

> [xrpd](#comment_5_12dctSb6GMpcRWnHjMXmEMrv3QvtHWpj2o): how do you make a subboard or subzero :D

I am replying to my own question.  You do it like this:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:9_1CMYxdit4qq9QGk9DYRu2ruRPd2YDGckH8/How+can+I+create+subforums+like+the+P2P+Newsflow+subcategory

1_12dctSb6GMpcRWnHjMXmEMrv3QvtHWpj2o.body: So far the easiest for me was to go to http://zero.pags.to:43110/ - a public ZeroNet node - and check out the side bar.

> [ancap](#comment_12_1FYXQGLBeNabf5jZHgP4CwzbmJSKaK4oMz): People post links to ZeroBoard.Also there are few search engines, but still experimental.

http://zeroexpose.com/ seems to be the best search engine that I've found
